Dear Ms. Hill:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager, at 616.552.3662.

ALLEGATION: The agency allowed an applicant to voluntarily withdraw their
application when there was evidence of rule noncompliance.
INVESTIGATION: An investigation into the allegation was conducted on 1/16/2020
at Bethany Christian Services. The licensing supervisor stated that the original 3130
was sent to DCWL recommending licensure of the foster home applicants. Shortly
after the 3130 was sent to DCWL, the licensing worker terminated her employment
with Bethany Christian Services and the current licensing supervisor took over.
The current licensing supervisor stated a request for further information on the 3130
was received from DCWL and he contacted the applicants. He stated while
speaking with the potential foster mother she mentioned a police investigation that
had been done, and said it was no big deal. The supervisor used a FOIA request to
gain access to the report which indicated an inappropriate relationship between the
potential foster father and a teenager. He was not charged.
2

The current licensing supervisor stated that the potential foster mother also stated
that she and her husband went to therapy due to marital problems. This had not
been disclosed to the previous licensing worker and was not in the 3130.
The licensing supervisor stated after learning of these situations, he gave them three
options; transfer to another agency, withdraw their application or denial of the
application. The applicants chose to withdraw their application.
This information was corroborated by the foster care supervisor and agency director.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12309 Records check.
(1) An agency shall, upon receipt of an application, request the
department of state police to conduct both a criminal history
check and a criminal records check through the federal bureau
of investigation for applicants. The agency shall also request
the department to conduct a criminal history check on all
persons residing in the home over 18 years of age. Additional
checks shall pertain to previous licenses, and substantiated
child abuse and neglect records for all applicants and persons
residing in the home 18 years of age or over in Michigan and in
all states where the applicant has resided in the 5 years
preceding the application.
ANALYSIS: The licensing worker that wrote the original 3130 conducted a
criminal history check on the applicants. The current licensing
worker, upon receiving information of further involvement with
law enforcement, submitted a FOIA request to the local county
sheriff’s department and received additional information
involving the potential foster father applicant.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12310 Initial evaluation.
(3) The report shall be an assessment of all of the following:
(i) Marital and family status and history, including current and
past level of family functioning and relationships and any
incidents of domestic violence.
(c) Previous criminal convictions, and substantiated child abuse
or neglect investigations or concerns brought to the agency’s or
department’s attention for any member of the household.
3

ANALYSIS: Upon receiving a request from DCWL for an addendum to the
original 3130, related to previous law enforcement involvement;
and after learning of martial problems that had not been
disclosed to the previous licensing worker, the licensing worker
failed to complete an addendum updating the original 3130 with
the new information and make an appropriate recommendation.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12325 License recommendation.
(1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
appropriate licensing action consistent with facts contained in
the foster home evaluation and any special evaluations.
ANALYSIS: Upon receiving a request from DCWL for an addendum to the
original 3130, related to previous law enforcement involvement;
and after learning of martial problems that had not been
disclosed to the previous licensing worker, the licensing worker
failed to complete an addendum updating the original 3130 with
the new information and requesting a denial of licensure. Rather
the applicants were allowed to withdraw their application.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change to this
Child Placing Agency license – Private.
